cohort.reelThemIn: “It is a capital mistake to theorize before one has data.” - Sir Arthur Conan Doyle, Sherlock Holmes
cohort.bio: My experience in the field of social science has cultivated a deep interest in understanding and using data. Taking the course on data science has enhanced my analytical skills. Now, as an aspiring data scientist, I am keen to discover and implement the best new practices to solve problems using data.

I don't consider myself a 'computer person'. Becoming a Data Scientist is the last thing I would’ve guessed was in store for me. The problem for me is I’m a huge people person and there’s a widespread misconception that programmers are introverts and hate people. So for several years I agonized over finding a career — totally ignoring programming — until I went to see a career counselor who steered me toward the unthinkable. Right away, I found a sense of fulfillment in giving presentations and solving data problems. I'm a creative person and I think science depends on creativity.

cohort.reelThemIn: Every challenge is an opportunity to excel and/or to learn.
cohort.bio: I’ve always been fond of numbers, but I fell in love with science and academic research. After becoming disillusioned by academia, I returned to my business roots. Regrettably, business lacks the excitement of the scientific process, but by going to meetups, I suddenly found myself among data analysts and data scientists and I suddenly realized how I can combine my passion for numbers, analytical thinking and my business experience. Today I want to help businesses grow by applying data science!

cohort.reelThemIn: “If we have data, let's look at data. If all we have are opinions, let's go with mine.” - Jim Barksdale
cohort.bio: I am a Nashville native and versatile analyst that is enthusiastic about working with large amounts of data to deliver insights for action-oriented solutions to complex biological, social, political, and economic challenges.

cohort.reelThemIn: “Do not allow your mind to be imprisoned by majority thinking.” - Patricia Bath
cohort.bio: I've always enjoyed solving problems and with a background in accounting, data science is a great way to go. Being able to combine problem-solving skills with the ability to make predictions, is what I look forward to the most being a data scientist.

cohort.reelThemIn: “I have always believed, and I still believe, that whatever good or bad fortune may come our way we can always give it meaning and transform it into something of value.” - Hermann Hesse
cohort.bio: I try to make the most out of every situation

cohort.reelThemIn: “Data is the new science, Big Data holds the answers.” - Pat Gelsinger
cohort.bio: A Statistician + Data Scientist with statistics background and real world project expreriences in data science.

cohort.reelThemIn: I never met a data problem I didn't like.
cohort.bio:
I am currently transitioning from the role of Data Analyst and am seeking roles as a Data Scientist.
My first job out of college was as a paper filer. It wasn’t a fun job, but it gave me time to think and to learn from the success of my peers. I learned how hard work, creativity, timing, and a bit of luck can help you create a career you’re proud of. I look forward to sharing how this was true for me.

cohort.reelThemIn: “Torture the data, and it will confess to anything.” - Ronald Coase
cohort.bio: I have served proudly in the United States Marine Corps as an 0341 Mortorman. I served in 2009 - 2013 and served all four years honorably. Additionally, I worked as a Competitive Intelligence Analyst, where I find trends in data to see why overpayment on claims have occurred. Now, I currently work for HealthTrust Purchasing Group, as a Associate Business Intelligence Analyst. In my current position I create reporting dashboards for business owners through Power BI.

cohort.reelThemIn: Always consider “what you know ain't so.” - Mark Twain
cohort.bio: I help organizations harness the unknown knowable while uncovering assumptions masquerading as fact. I am a retired Military Intelligence Officer, Decision Systems Consultant and an emergent Data Scientist.

After years of training and working as a microbiologist, including a PhD from Vanderbilt University, I have learned how to approach a problem critically and develop an approach to solve it. I am excited to take these analytical and problem solving skills and apply them to data science. I love learning new methods and techniques to explore, clean, and gain insights from data in a way that brings actionable results with real value for the end client.

cohort.reelThemIn: “You can have data without information, but you cannot have information without data.” - Daniel Keys Moran
cohort.bio: My experience in biomedical research, business development and clinical trials revolved around one aspect: “data” that provided knowledge. I pursued data science to learn tools to turn vast amounts of data into insights that will facilitate business decisions.

As a software developer for more than 13 years, I have learned to quickly adapt to new technologies. I throughly enjoy fetching information from various sources and analyzing it to better understand how the business performs. With the data science skills I have acquired, I would like to take it to the next level by building AI tools that automate certain processes within the company.

cohort.reelThemIn: Analyst, Web Scraping, Junior Data Scientist
cohort.bio: I am passionate about building actionable data science projects.

cohort.reelThemIn: Keep a loss function in mind and update the weights periodically to approach the ground truth.
cohort.bio: My background is in data analytics. Cleaning up various messy data sets and finding data resources as required is my favorite part, followed by modelling although I can tune a good model. I keep my skills up to date via learning platforms and apply them to my work agilely.
